epics.name: Foundations
epics.description: Initial epic to group foundational tasks.

tasks.title: Reposition MCP screen button above Settings
tasks.description: Move the MCP configuration screen button to the bottom of the ActivityBar, just above the Settings button, following the new layout request.

tasks.title: Fix MCP pipeline TypeScript errors
tasks.description: Resolve the compilation errors called out in MCP-related files (missing properties, unused imports, typing mismatches in drawer, unused args).

tasks.title: Ensure MCP tool choices reach LLM nodes
tasks.description: Verify that MCP tools are included along with selected tool choices when invoking LLM nodes, and implement any required wiring.

tasks.title: Wire MCP tools into provider pipeline
tasks.description: Make agent tools dynamic, expose MCP-derived tools, and verify Flow/LLM nodes can invoke them with telemetry.

tasks.title: Support HTTP MCP servers
tasks.description: Extend MCP service, RPC, and renderer to configure and use HTTP transport servers.

tasks.title: Support JSON snippet import when adding MCP servers
tasks.description: Make JSON snippet paste the default add flow in the MCP configuration screen, with manual configuration as an optional fallback.

tasks.title: Build MCP configuration screen
tasks.description: Add the MCP view, Zustand store, and Mantine UI for managing MCP servers (list, add/edit/test) following the MCP plan.

tasks.title: Fix MCP service compilation errors
tasks.description: Resolve TypeScript module resolution issues and type errors in electron/services/McpService.ts so the backend builds cleanly.

tasks.title: Implement MCP backend service and RPC
tasks.description: Create McpService, register it, add mcp.* RPC handlers, and broadcast mcp.servers.changed events per the MCP support plan.

tasks.title: Plan MCP support feature
tasks.description: Plan architecture and scope for adding MCP support including UI screen for configuring MCP servers, backend support, and provider wiring.

tasks.title: Clarify Playwright browser packaging requirements
tasks.description: (Deprecated) Playwright packaging guidance no longer needed after removing crawler-based tools.

tasks.title: Run live webSearchMarkdown integration test and ensure Google results
tasks.description: (Deprecated) Task superseded by removal of webSearchMarkdown/webFetchMarkdown. No further action required.

tasks.title: Remove webFetch/webSearch tools and related dependencies
tasks.description: Roll back the Playwright-based webFetchMarkdown and webSearchMarkdown tooling (code, tests, packaging changes, dependencies, KB entries) now that the approach is being abandoned. Ensure all references, docs, and build steps are cleanly removed.

tasks.title: Add live Google search integration test for webSearchMarkdown
tasks.description: Add an integration test (opt-in via env flag) that exercises webSearchMarkdown against the real Google UI using Playwright, ensuring the tool returns at least one organic result and surfaces failures when Google blocks the request. Include documentation on how/when to run it.

tasks.title: Simplify Google crawling for webSearchMarkdown
tasks.description: Reimplement webSearchMarkdown (and supporting utilities) using a direct Playwright flow similar to the reference Python script so that Google SERPs load reliably without extensive cookie or header management. Ensure the tool extracts results successfully and tests cover the new flow.

tasks.title: Fix webSearchMarkdown Google crawling timeouts and ensure successful result retrieval
tasks.description: Google SERP runs are still timing out or returning zero results in production (enable-js loops, requestHandler timeout). Investigate PlaywrightCrawler settings, timeouts, and fingerprint/session handling so the tool consistently returns snippets. Update tests so they only pass when results are produced.

tasks.title: Fix ReferenceError appliedUserAgent in webSearchMarkdown crawler
tasks.description: Investigate why runtime logs still show "ReferenceError: appliedUserAgent is not defined" inside the Playwright crawler preNavigation hook for webSearchMarkdown, even after the previous fix. Ensure the crawler declares and forwards the applied user agent correctly so Google searches execute without crashing.

tasks.title: Fix webSearchMarkdown ReferenceError appliedUserAgent undefined
tasks.description: Investigate and fix the ReferenceError: appliedUserAgent is not defined thrown inside PlaywrightCrawler preNavigationHooks for Google searches. Ensure crawls succeed without hitting the enable-js challenge.

tasks.title: Mitigate Google enable-js blocking in webSearchMarkdown
tasks.description: webSearchMarkdown still fails because Google Search continues to return the enable-js challenge, causing Crawlee to give up after retries. Investigate PlaywrightCrawler configuration (sessions, proxies, navigation flow, humanization) and update the tooling so that Google SERP DOM is reliably captured again. Include tests/logging updates as needed.

tasks.title: Fix webSearchMarkdown crawling failures on Google results
tasks.description: Investigate why PlaywrightCrawler is returning no DOM content for Google SERP and downstream result pages, resolve the blocking detection / enable-js loop, and ensure webSearchMarkdown provides usable snippets again.

tasks.title: Switch Crawlee tooling to @playwright/electron
tasks.description: Replace direct Playwright browser bundling with @playwright/electron so the crawlers can reuse the app's built-in Chromium without shipping separate browser binaries. Update tooling, packaging, and documentation accordingly.

tasks.title: Fix webSearchMarkdown Google crawler returning no DOM
tasks.description: Investigate recent failures where the PlaywrightCrawler exits after 1 request without capturing Google SERP DOM and webSearchMarkdown returns "Google Search returned no DOM content". Ensure the crawler runs the queued requests and returns DOM snippets reliably.

tasks.title: Verify Playwright dependency bundling for Electron app
tasks.description: Answer whether current Playwright browser installation approach (postinstall script) is appropriate for packaging the Electron app and document any adjustments needed.

tasks.title: Automate Playwright dependency installation
tasks.description: Ensure browser dependencies (npx playwright install --with-deps) run automatically during packaging/deployment so crawling tools work out-of-the-box.

tasks.title: Install Playwright browser dependencies for web tools
tasks.description: Run the Playwright install command (e.g., `npx playwright install --with-deps`) so the browser-based crawlers can launch successfully and verify the tooling works afterward.

tasks.title: Upgrade webFetchMarkdown and webSearchMarkdown to use PlaywrightCrawler
tasks.description: Migrate the webFetchMarkdown and webSearchMarkdown tools to use Crawlee with PlaywrightCrawler to avoid bot detection, including dependency updates and necessary refactors.

tasks.title: Fix webSearchMarkdown returning zero results
tasks.description: Investigate why webSearchMarkdown returns empty results with query "javascript database" despite successful completion. Ensure Google SERP parsing and crawling produce context snippets.

tasks.title: Implement webSearchMarkdown tool
tasks.description: Design and implement a new webSearchMarkdown tool that performs a search query (e.g., Google), crawls the top 5 results plus AI response, and returns context snippets using the same tooling as webFetchMarkdown.

tasks.title: Buffer API key edits locally and only persist on save
tasks.description: Keep API key inputs local until the user presses Save/Validate instead of dispatching handleApiKeysChange on every keystroke.

tasks.title: Evaluate API key input performance mitigation plan
Investigate SettingsPane API key input performance
tasks.description: Determine why typing into the API key fields incurs ~250ms latency per keystroke and identify non-local side effects or redundant work causing the slowdown.

tasks.title: Improve settings UI to use zustand local state with explicit save actions
tasks.description: UI is persisting to backend on every keystroke. Update SettingsPane and related logic to buffer changes locally in the zustand store and add save/confirm/validate buttons that trigger RPC calls only when invoked.

tasks.title: Fix SettingsPane settingsApiKeys type error
tasks.description: Resolve the TS2345 type mismatch in src/SettingsPane.tsx when updating state with settingsApiKeys.

tasks.title: Audit Settings screen API key handling and remove useEffect usage
tasks.description: Investigate why the Settings screen does not accept API key input, audit the entire screen for correctness, and ensure no useEffect hooks are used while keeping functionality intact. Implement necessary fixes and tests.

tasks.title: Enhance webFetchMarkdown search context and tool description
tasks.description: Update the webFetchMarkdown tool so that search-context snippets include ~50 lines of context before and after each match, and revise the tool description so LLMs know about the optional search parameter and its behavior.

tasks.title: Add optional search context extraction to webFetchMarkdown
tasks.description: Redesign the Crawlee-based fetchMarkdown tool so it accepts an optional search parameter and returns scoped context around matching keywords when provided.

tasks.title: Fix webFetchMarkdown returning no content
tasks.description: Investigate why electron/tools/web/fetchMarkdown returns ok:false and "No content was captured" for real pages like https://ai-sdk.dev/providers/ai-sdk-providers/openai#image-inputs and update the implementation/tests accordingly.

tasks.title: Fix type errors in fetchMarkdown tool and unused import in TokensCostsPanel
tasks.description: Resolve the TypeScript errors reported in electron/tools/web/fetchMarkdown.ts for the ResponseContent typing and remove the unused Divider import from src/components/TokensCostsPanel.tsx.

tasks.title: Build Crawlee-based URL fetch-to-Markdown tool
tasks.description: Implement an agent tool that uses Crawlee's CheerioCrawler to fetch a URL, convert the page HTML to Markdown (via Turndown or similar), and return the Markdown to the requesting agent. Include necessary dependencies and wiring so agents can call this tool.

tasks.title: Compact tokens & costs per-request section
tasks.description: Make the per-request section of the tokens & costs panel more compact while retaining all the same information.

tasks.title: Fix FlowStatusIndicator.tsx TS errors: ReactNode, nodeId, badgeColor dup, StatusConfig, FlowService, requestId
Implement Badge Configuration Registry
tasks.description: Create centralized badge configuration system to eliminate duplication and multiple mutation points

tasks.title: Review the Kanban board
tasks.description: Open the Kanban view and explore drag & drop between columns.

tasks.title: Move all in-progress tasks to done
tasks.description: Per user request, move every task currently in the In Progress column to Done.

tasks.title: Refactor KanbanView to use Zustand instead of useEffect/useMemo
tasks.description:
Remove all useEffect and useMemo hooks from KanbanView.tsx and move state management to Zustand stores. This includes:
1. Move tasksByStatus and epicMap computations to useKanban store as derived state
2. Move screen phase transition logic to useKanbanHydration store
3. Create new useKanbanUI store for modal/drawer state
4. Move form state from local useState to the UI store
5. Ensure all error notifications are handled at store level

tasks.title: Fix Kanban task creation form fields not editable
tasks.description: In the Kanban view, when creating a new task, the fields (title, description, assignees, tags, etc.) are not editable. This appears to be a UI bug where the form inputs are disabled or not properly wired to state management.

tasks.title: Audit applyEdits badge line count visibility
tasks.description: Audit the applyEdits badge logic to restore missing line count pills. Investigate BadgeProcessor, badge configurations, and frontend renderers to ensure a single source of truth for badge behavior.

tasks.title: Fix TS2307: Cannot find module './viewers/TerminalExecViewer' in BadgeContent.tsx
tasks.description: BadgeContent.tsx line 18 imports non-existent src/components/session/Badge/viewers/TerminalExecViewer.tsx (added in task-742cd1da but file not created). Create the React viewer component matching patterns in other viewers (e.g. WorkspaceSearchViewer.tsx): render command header, truncated output preview in copyable code block, exit code/status, duration/lines, timedOut indicator, truncation note. Ensure BadgeExpansionContent wrapper, Chakra UI styling, and tsc clean. Verify expandable badges now work for terminalExec.

tasks.title: Fix TypeScript errors in electron/services/ptySpawn.ts
tasks.description: Resolve TS7006 (implicit any for 'chunk') and TS6133 (unused 'signal') in ptySpawn.ts. Ensure type safety and remove unused parameters.

tasks.title: Fix terminalExec wsService.getPath not a function error
Implement node-pty per-command exit detection for terminalExec (hybrid persistent/non-interactive)
tasks.description: User: Use node-pty onExit for robust completion/exit code instead of regex. Audit: Current agentPty spawns single persistent shell PTY; onExit only on shell kill. Plan: Add optional nonInteractive param to terminalExec (default false persistent shell). If true: temp spawn(cmd args, no shell) â†’ onData collect, onExit return output+exitCode. Preserve UI for persistent. Update desc/schema. Files: exec.ts (if/branch), agentPty.ts (new spawnCmd func). Tests: quick/error/long cmds. Verify tsc.

tasks.title: Enhance terminalExec completion detection (human-like prompt return, exit code if possible)
tasks.description: User: Enhance detection as main fix. Check agentPty for exit code support. Improve to match human terminal observation: reliable prompt restoration + stable output, trim prompts from output, generic long-running msg. Plan/implem: better regex/idle, post-trim, agentPty audit. Files: electron/tools/terminal/exec.ts, services/agentPty.ts. Tests, verify tsc.

tasks.title: Add Deepseek 3.2 model to Fireworks provider
tasks.description:
Add Deepseek 3.2 as a pre-configured model for Fireworks.
Path: accounts/fireworks/models/deepseek-v3p2
Pricing:
- Input: $0.56 / 1M
- Output: $1.68 / 1M

tasks.title: Root Cause Fix for Missing IDs in Usage Breakdown
tasks.description: Investigate why usage_breakdown events are missing nodeId and executionId in LLMService. Refactor the code to ensure these IDs are strictly propagated from the request context to the event emission point, eliminating the need for 'best-effort' recovery in the TimelineEventHandler.

tasks.title: Fix await usage error in llm-service rate limit check
tasks.description: Build fails with: "await can only be used inside an async function" at llm-service.ts line 925 for rateLimitTracker.checkAndWait call. Update function signature/call site to be async-safe and ensure rate limiting works.

tasks.title: Redesign workspaceMap for language-agnostic repository mapping
tasks.description: Define and implement a generic workspaceMap tool that produces useful structure summaries for arbitrary repositories (any language/tooling), replacing the current renderer/electron-specific heuristics.

tasks.title: Refactor Settings pane data hydration and backend alignment
tasks.description:
Implement the Settings pane refactor per the documented audit plan:
1. Share a typed settings snapshot populated from SettingsService, ProviderService, and AppService startup message.
2. Build a renderer hook to hydrate and subscribe to settings/provider updates, ensuring API keys and provider validity load immediately.
3. Align Fireworks allowlist/load-defaults RPCs with backend handlers and return updated allowlists/models.
4. Await provider RPCs in the UI, surface errors, and clean up stale "load defaults" wiring.

tasks.title: Fix Tokens & Costs panel input tokens and cost math
tasks.description: User reports: "The cost and token reporting still isn't right. input tokens aren't coming through. And I think the math is wrong on the costing." Investigate end-to-end token & cost reporting, focusing on missing input tokens and incorrect cost math. Verify backend usage_breakdown payload, renderer aggregation, and per-model pricing tables.

tasks.title: Fix terminalExec tool syntax error
tasks.description: Address the syntax error at electron/tools/terminal/exec.ts:76 introduced during the single-parameter refactor. Restore valid TypeScript by correcting the schema definition (missing comma) and ensure the module builds cleanly.

tasks.title: Stop session.usage.changed emissions when usage data unchanged
tasks.description: Renderer logs show session.usage.changed being emitted for every streamed chunk even though the payload is identical. Update the backend/event pipeline so session usage events are only emitted when tokenUsage/costs/requestsLog actually change, preventing redundant renderer updates.

tasks.title: Audit terminalExec tool logic, report current behavior, and plan fixes
tasks.description: User reports: \"I think the logic in the terminal exec tool is wrong. It should: execute the command, wait for the command to complete execution, return with the full results of the command execution (up to 500 lines) (but no prompt) unless it takes more than a minute, in which case it should return with however much output there is (up to 500 lines) inform the llm that the tool is taking a long time to execute and suggest other follow-up tools to use.\" Audit the source code at electron/tools/terminal/exec.ts, report exactly what it currently does (including timeouts, idle detection, output limits, prompt stripping), identify discrepancies vs desired behavior, and create a detailed fix plan including code changes, tests, and tool description updates.

tasks.title: Update Tools node config options post-terminal refactor
Fix TS errors in src/components/session/Badge/viewers/TerminalExecViewer.tsx
Fix stale terminal sessionCommandOutput import in tools/index.ts
Fix getTerminalService not exported error in event-subscriptions.ts
Summarize current Kanban board state
tasks.description: Read the Kanban board and provide the requester with a concise summary of task distribution and key items.

tasks.title: Summarize current Kanban board state
tasks.description: Read the Kanban board and provide the requester with a concise summary of task distribution and key items.

tasks.title: Exclude done status items from kanbanGetBoard responses
tasks.description: Update the kanbanGetBoard tool implementation so it no longer returns tasks in the done column/status. Ensure the filtering happens server-side, adjust tests/docs, and confirm downstream consumers no longer see done items.

tasks.title: Fix Kanban service-handlers workspaceId + FlowStatusIndicator TS errors
tasks.description: tsc currently fails with multiple errors in electron/backend/ws/service-handlers.ts (missing workspaceId argument + wrong parameter counts) and src/components/FlowStatusIndicator.tsx (implicit any). Update the websocket handlers to pass workspaceId through all Kanban RPC calls and fix the FlowStatusIndicator typing issue so tsc runs cleanly.

tasks.title: Fix cached input price calculation
tasks.description: User reports cached input prices are incorrect in the usage/tokens-costs pipeline. Audit the cached input token accounting and pricing math across backend usage emission and renderer aggregation, then implement fixes so cached input cost reflects the real model pricing and cached tokens.

tasks.title: Fix Kanban create task 'Create rejected' error
tasks.description: Saving a new Kanban task now fails with Error: "Create rejected" from handleSubmitTask in KanbanView. Investigate renderer store payload, RPC wiring, and backend validation to ensure task creation succeeds.

tasks.title: Fix Kanban task creation missing workspaceId on save
tasks.description: Saving a new Kanban task fails with "Missing required parameter: input.workspaceId". Audit the task creation flow (renderer stores, RPC wiring, backend handler) and ensure workspaceId is passed through everywhere so Kanban task creation succeeds.

tasks.title: Update KanbanView to pass workspaceId in all RPC calls
tasks.description: Update all RPC calls in KanbanView.tsx to include the workspaceId parameter. The workspaceId is available via useBackendBinding store. All kanban RPC methods (moveTask, deleteTask, updateTask, createTask, updateEpic, deleteEpic, createEpic, archiveTasks) need to be updated to include workspaceId.

tasks.title: Audit and Fix Kanban RPC Calls (Drag & Drop, Archive)
tasks.description: The user reports that dragging tasks (status change) and archiving do not work. Audit the Kanban screen and backend communication. Investigate RPC handlers for moveTask and updateTask/archiveTask. Ensure backend mutations are correctly wired and frontend updates reflect the changes.

tasks.title: Create BadgeProcessor with configuration registry
tasks.description: Phase 1: Implement BadgeProcessor class with centralized badge configuration registry to eliminate duplicate badge logic

tasks.title: Analyze badge system architectural issues
tasks.description: Analyzed duplication and complexity across badge creation, processing, and rendering components. Found major architectural issues with multiple mutation points and inconsistent data flow.

tasks.title: Debug and fix terminalExec tool badges not showing expandable chevrons in UI
Fix FlowStatusIndicator.tsx import error for useSession
tasks.description: Fix Vite import error in FlowStatusIndicator.tsx: Failed to resolve import "../hooks/useSession". Find correct path and update import.

tasks.title: Add comprehensive badge system tests
tasks.description: Create unit and integration tests for new badge system to prevent regressions

tasks.title: Migrate terminal exec to new badge system
tasks.description: Update terminal exec tool to use new BadgeProcessor as proof of concept

tasks.title: Create Unified BadgeProcessor class
tasks.description: Implement BadgeProcessor to replace the massive enrichBadgeWithToolData function

tasks.title: Fix terminalExec tool badges data-can-expand="false" (no chevron/expansion in UI)
Fix terminalExec badges not rendering expansion in UI
Fix remaining tsc errors: unused @ts-expect-error in ptySpawn.ts and unused expansion in terminal/exec.ts
Fix TS6133/TS2307: unused/missing useUiStore import in src/components/session/Badge/viewers/TerminalExecViewer.tsx
Fix TS17002: Expected corresponding JSX closing tag for 'div' in src/components/session/Badge/viewers/TerminalExecViewer.tsx(219,7)
Enhance terminalExec tool badge with name and expandable output
tasks.description: User reports terminalExec badge lacks name and expandable content for command results. Implement NodeBadgeData in tool result: badgeName='terminalExec: {command preview}', badgeExpansion='Output preview + exitCode/duration/timedOut'. Align with existing tool badge patterns. Files: electron/tools/terminal/exec.ts (add badge to return), verify src/components/NodeBadgeContent.tsx renders it. Update tool description. Test via flow exec + UI.

tasks.title: Iteratively run tsc and fix all TS compilation errors until clean
Fix React DOM nesting warning: div cannot appear as descendant of p in FlowStatusIndicator
Fix getTerminalService not exported error in terminal-handlers.ts
Fix stale agentPty import in terminal-handlers.ts
Fix ptySpawn.ts syntax/ESBuild errors (whitespace, types, Promise.race)
Refactor KanbanView to use Zustand instead of useEffect/useMemo
tasks.description:
Remove all useEffect and useMemo hooks from KanbanView.tsx and move state management to Zustand stores. This includes:
1. Move tasksByStatus and epicMap computations to useKanban store as derived state
2. Move screen phase transition logic to useKanbanHydration store
3. Create new useKanbanUI store for modal/drawer state
4. Move form state from local useState to the UI store
5. Ensure all error notifications are handled at store level

tasks.title: Support Markdown in Thinking Blocks
tasks.description: Update the renderer to support Markdown within reasoning/thinking blocks instead of plain text.

tasks.title: Verify Renderer Display for Thinking and Tool Usage
tasks.description: Audit and verify the frontend renderer to ensuring reasoning, tool usage, and text chunks are displayed correctly.

tasks.title: Audit and Fix Fireworks Provider for Tool Calling and Thinking Models
tasks.description:
User reports tool calls are not parsed correctly in the Fireworks provider.
Goal: Audit `fireworks` provider implementation.
Requirements:
1. Ensure correct support for tool calling.
2. Ensure support for "thinking" and "reasoning" models.
3. Verify implementation against expected AI SDK standards.
4. Fix any issues found.

tasks.title: Add kimi-k2-thinking model to Fireworks provider
tasks.description:
Add `accounts/fireworks/models/kimi-k2-thinking` as a pre-configured model for Fireworks.
Pricing:
- Input: 0.6 / 1M
- Output: 2.5 / 1M

tasks.title: Fix stop button errors and missing sessionId in broadcastFlowEvent
tasks.description:
User reports stop button doesn't change UI and throws errors:
1. `[broadcastFlowEvent] Failed to find workspace for sessionId: null event type: done`
2. `[FlowScheduler] userInput-... cancelled`
3. `Unhandled rejection: Flow execution cancelled`

Investigate `FlowStatusIndicator` stop button handler, `broadcastFlowEvent` null sessionId, and handle cancellation rejections properly.

tasks.title: Switch terminalExec to non-interactive spawn-only, remove agent terminal panel/UI, display results in tool badge
tasks.description: Full refactor: non-interactive per-command pty spawn with exitCode; delete persistent PTY/UI panel; tool badge shows output/exit. Update related tools (tail/search deprecated).

tasks.title: Fix FlowStatusIndicator RPC calls
tasks.description: Rename flow.cancel to flow.stop in backend and frontend to match UI intent. Check flow.start consistency.

tasks.title: Remove Agent Terminal Panel
tasks.description: Remove the "agent" terminal panel from GlobalSessionPanel.tsx as it is no longer used (per user request and recent refactors moving to tool badges). Also clean up any dead code in TerminalPanel or store if it's strictly unused, but focus on the UI removal first.

tasks.title: Standardize tool badge parameter display
tasks.description: Tools like `kanbanGetBoard` and `knowledgeBaseSearch` are not sending/displaying params correctly in the tool badges. Ensure all tools consistently follow the format `[TOOL NAME] params (lines affected)`. Investigate tool definitions and badge generation logic.

tasks.title: Themify TerminalExecViewer
tasks.description: Improve styling of expanded terminal exec badges to match the application theme.

tasks.title: Harden TerminalExecViewer against malformed data
tasks.description: Modify TerminalExecViewer.tsx to safely handle cases where exitCode is an object (legacy/malformed data) to prevent React rendering crashes.

tasks.title: Fix TerminalExecViewer React object rendering error
tasks.description: User reports 'Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {exitCode})' when expanding terminalExec badge. Investigate TerminalExecViewer.tsx and fix the rendering logic.

tasks.title: Fix TS errors in badge-processor.ts
tasks.description:
Fix TS2322 and TS6133 errors in electron/flow-engine/badge-processor.ts.
Errors:
- Type '(badge: any) => "error" | "success" | "warning"' is not assignable to 'BadgeStatus'. (BadgeStatus likely missing "warning")
- 'badge' declared but value never read.

tasks.title: Debug flow status stuck on "Waiting on user input": trace backend to frontend
tasks.description: User reports: "Waiting on user input" status never changes/advances. Trace the flow status logic end-to-end: backend FlowScheduler/flow-engine status emission, websocket events to renderer, zustand store selectors (useFlowRuntime), and FlowStatusIndicator rendering logic. Identify why waitingForInput status persists after input submission or flow completion. Include reproduction steps if found, logs, and fix.

tasks.title: Fix flow status indicator: input box only when required
tasks.description: In the flow status indicator, we're no longer correctly displaying the running / waiting for input box. The input box should only be displayed when input is required.

tasks.title: Add current executing node badge to FlowStatusIndicator running message
tasks.description: Display "Flow Running... [NodeName]" with color-matched badge (from node editor color map). Use flowRuntime.currentNodeId to fetch name/color.

tasks.title: Fix TypeScript compilation errors from tsc (FlowStatusIndicator.tsx)
Fix remaining tsc errors (includeThoughts FlowExecutionArgs, FlowStatusIndicator unused/prop errors, SessionControlsBar unused imports/refs/errors)
Fix remaining tsc errors (includeThoughts in FlowExecutionArgs, FlowStatusIndicator NodeExecState logic/unused, SessionControlsBar unused imports/vars)
Fix FlowStatusIndicator default export SyntaxError in SessionControlsBar
tasks.description: Uncaught SyntaxError: The requested module '/src/components/FlowStatusIndicator.tsx' does not provide an export named 'default' (at SessionControlsBar.tsx:14:8). FlowStatusIndicator uses named export but is imported as default. Add default export to match import pattern.

tasks.title: Return terminalExec output immediately when command exits with error
tasks.description: terminalExec now returns quickly when a command finishes successfully, but erroring commands that already completed still wait for the full timeout window. Update the terminal exec tool so it detects completion after non-zero exit statuses (or error prompts) and returns the captured stderr/stdout right away instead of blocking for the configured timeout. Add coverage/docs as needed.

tasks.title: Ensure terminalExec returns immediately when command completes
tasks.description: Investigate the terminalExec tool and fix cases where completed commands still wait for the configured timeout before returning output. Commands that finish should return immediately with their captured output instead of blocking for the remainder of the timeout window. Add tests or logging as needed to verify the behavior.

tasks.title: Throttle session.usage.changed logging in renderer
tasks.description: Renderer console logs the full session usage payload for every chunk ("[sessionUi] Received session.usage.changed ..."), creating excessive spam. Adjust the renderer logging or subscription so detailed usage logs only appear when debug logging is enabled or at a lower frequency, while keeping UI updates intact.

tasks.title: Enable reasoning content & default thinking for Firebase tool calls
tasks.description: Per latest docs, Firebase-hosted models require reasoning content to be returned for tool-calling to function, and the "thinking" (reasoning traces) option must be enabled by default. Audit the model/provider config to ensure reasoning content is returned for Firebase models (currently only GPT is covered) and update defaults so thinking is enabled globally. Update any settings UI or API surfaces to reflect this behavior, add tests, and document the change.

tasks.title: Simplify terminalExec tool API to single-parameter command
tasks.description:
Refactor the terminalExec tool so it only accepts a single `command` parameter.
- Hard-code timeout/idle/output limits via module constants (easily adjustable).
- Block up to 60s or until the command completes, returning up to 500 lines of output.
- If the command is still running or produces more than 500 lines, respond with "Command is long running and still in progress, use terminalSessionCommandOutput to see current state" and include continuation context.
- Remove unused/dead code from the existing implementation.
- Update tool descriptions/docs to match the simplified API and behavior.

tasks.title: Increase terminalExec early return timeout and document behavior
tasks.description: Extend the early-return timer for terminalExec to 60s for long-running commands and enhance terminal tool descriptions so LLMs understand continuation behavior.

tasks.title: Improve terminal tool output handling for long-running commands
tasks.description: LLMs get partial output from long-running terminal commands and seldom use tail/search to see the remainder. Design and implement a better UX for terminal tool responses (e.g., automatic chunking with continuation tokens, explicit prompts to call tail/search, or alternative streaming). Include renderer/CLI updates, documentation, and tests as needed.

tasks.title: Filter archived cards from kanbanGetBoard responses
tasks.description: kanbanGetBoard currently returns archived tasks to LLM callers, which should not happen. Update the board service/tool so archived tasks are excluded from responses (or clearly hidden) when the tool is invoked.

tasks.title: Emit __setUsage only when LLM usage data is available
tasks.description: __setUsage events are currently sent on every streamed chunk, causing major performance issues in the renderer. Update the usage pipeline so the event fires only when actual usage data is returned by the LLM (e.g., usage_breakdown/final result), rather than per chunk. Ensure existing usage badges and tokens-cost panel still update correctly, and add tests/logging if needed.

tasks.title: Always log final LLM request config
tasks.description: Remove the HF_FLOW_DEBUG guard around the agentStream config logging so we always emit a sanitized log of the exact options passed to each provider call.

tasks.title: Log final LLM request options
tasks.description: Add logging that dumps the exact config object passed to provider LLM calls (after per-model overrides, normalization, etc.), not just the intermediate sampling parameters. Ensure logs can be toggled or scoped to debug builds.

tasks.title: Verify per-model temperature overrides are applied
tasks.description:
User suspects per-model temperature overrides are ignored. Prove whether overrides are used by tracing configuration resolution (flow settings -> provider model overrides -> LLM request payload) and, if missing, fix the wiring.

Deliverables:
1. Reproduction path showing whether overrides propagate to LLMService/chat requests (logs or tests).
2. Code fix if overrides arenâ€™t applied, or documentation/logging showing they are.
3. Tests/verification demonstrating temperature override behavior.
4. KB update summarizing override resolution.

tasks.title: Clarify applyEdits tool instructions/descriptions
tasks.description: Improve the user-facing instructions for the applyEdits tool (OpenAI Patch + Search/Replace formats). Ensure the guidance explains the supported formats, delimiters, required headers, and common pitfalls so LLMs can reliably apply edits.

tasks.title: Fix applyEdits OpenAI patch & search/replace failures
tasks.description:
LLMs report applyEdits still fails to modify files:
1. OpenAI patch format: *** Begin Patch + *** Update File with @@ hunk replacing Line 2 -> "partial-ok 0/1" (no change).
2. Search/Replace format: <<<<<<< SEARCH / ======= / >>>>>>> REPLACE returns "no-match" for Line 2 -> Modified Line 2.
Reproduce, fix parser/matcher, and ensure both formats succeed on bug-report-test.txt (`Line 1\nLine 2\nLine 3`). Add regression coverage.

tasks.title: Fix OpenAI patch format handling in applyEdits tool
tasks.description:
LLMs report that applyEdits rejects the documented OpenAI patch format. Two formats fail:
1) Basic patch with only Begin/Update headers and @@ hunk
2) Patch with context lines.
Detect why applyEdits rejects these inputs, fix the parser, and add regression tests so both variants succeed.

tasks.title: Prevent applyEdits from writing raw patch delimiters to files
tasks.description: On rare runs the applyEdits helper appears to write the literal patch markers (e.g., <<<<<<, ======, >>>>>>) and metadata into source files instead of applying the diff. Investigate the code path inside the applyEdits tool, identify how delimiters escape into the target file, and harden the implementation so only the intended edits are written. Add regression coverage if possible.

tasks.title: Fix TokensCostsPanel responsive grid constants
tasks.description: TypeScript build fails after cached token UI update: `summaryGridResponsive` and `inputGridResponsive` are referenced in TokensCostsPanel but the constants are not defined. Define/inline the responsive breakpoint objects or refactor the SimpleGrid usage so tsc passes again.

tasks.title: Promote cached tokens to first-class data in Tokens & Costs panel
tasks.description: Update the Tokens & Costs panel UI/state so cached tokens and costs are displayed as explicit, standalone metrics instead of mixing them into the regular input totals. Adjust layout, data bindings, and visual hierarchy to make cached vs non-cached usage easy to compare.

tasks.title: Format applyEdits tool description as Markdown
tasks.description:
Update the applyEdits tool metadata so its description field is a markdown-formatted block with explicit line endings, per user request.

Delivered:
- Rebuilt `electron/tools/edits/apply.ts` so the tool description is a Markdown doc assembled via `[].join('\n')`, covering Search/Replace, OpenAI Patch, and unified diff formats plus general rules.
- Verified TypeScript build is clean (`pnpm exec tsc --noEmit --pretty false`).

tasks.title: Redesign Tokens & Costs panel layout
tasks.description: Improve the Tokens & Costs panel UX by redesigning the layout for clarity. Goals: make aggregate totals, cached vs. regular costs, provider/model breakdowns, and per-request details easy to scan; introduce sensible grouping, typography hierarchy, and responsive behavior; ensure math still matches session cost data.

tasks.title: Reset terminal and rerun tsc for regression check
tasks.description: Restart the shared terminal session, run `pnpm exec tsc --noEmit --pretty false`, and report whether any TypeScript errors remain.

tasks.title: Run tsc and fix all syntax errors
tasks.description: Execute TypeScript compiler (tsc) across the repo, identify all syntax/type errors, and apply code fixes until tsc completes without errors. Document findings and tests.

tasks.title: Resolve llm-service try/catch syntax and ensure tsc is clean
tasks.description: Vite build fails with "Expected 'finally' but found '}'" around electron/flow-engine/llm-service.ts:692. Inspect the surrounding try/catch/finally block, restore valid syntax, and run `pnpm exec tsc --noEmit` to ensure TypeScript builds without errors. Fix any additional issues surfaced by tsc.

tasks.title: Fix syntax error in llm-service try/catch block
tasks.description: Build fails with "Expected 'finally' but found '}'" at electron/flow-engine/llm-service.ts:691. Inspect nearby try/catch/finally block for malformed syntax and restore valid structure so Vite/esbuild succeeds.

tasks.title: Fix Tokens & Costs panel line-item and cached totals
tasks.description: Line-item costs for token usage show 0 input cost while cached costs work, and the cached token cost total at the top does not update. Review the complete cost/token usage code paths end-to-end for math bugs, architecture issues, and add logging of raw provider token usage responses.

tasks.title: Refactor FlowNode NodeConfig component
tasks.description: Break down src/components/FlowNode/NodeConfig.tsx into modular subcomponents/hooks, move business logic into the store, remove useEffect usage, and clean out dead/duplicated code to reduce file size and improve architecture.

tasks.title: Report current line count of electron/flow-engine/llm-service.ts
tasks.description: Determine the present line count of electron/flow-engine/llm-service.ts after the recent refactor and report it to the user.

tasks.title: Modularize electron/flow-engine/llm-service.ts
tasks.description: Continue refactoring electron/flow-engine/llm-service.ts: eliminate duplicated helpers, split large responsibilities into cohesive modules, remove dead code paths, and ensure clean separation of concerns with existing flow-engine services.

tasks.title: Inventory files exceeding 500 lines
tasks.description: Audit the repository for large source files (>=500 lines), report their paths and sizes, and highlight candidates for refactor follow-ups.

tasks.title: Modularize FlowScheduler and break up scheduler.ts
tasks.description: FlowScheduler still sits in a ~1000-line scheduler.ts. Refactor it into cohesive modules: separate execution lifecycle management, context/portal handling, and dependency coordination; remove dead code paths; improve naming; and ensure FlowScheduler orchestrates rather than implements low-level behaviors. Deliver tests/verification and update docs.

tasks.title: Audit and remove dead code after flow/LLM refactor
tasks.description: Review the flow-engine and LLM modules for code that became unused after the monolith refactor (duplicate helpers, unused exports, unreachable branches). Remove the dead code, align imports, and ensure tests still pass.

tasks.title: Refactor oversized monolithic files for maintainability
tasks.description: Identify the largest monolithic source files (1000+ lines), design a refactor plan covering architecture, dead code removal, separation of concerns, and variable naming improvements, then implement the plan and validate the build/tests.

tasks.title: KB: Document Timeline Event Handling
tasks.description: Document the TimelineEventHandler architecture, specifically the usage_breakdown event handling and ID recovery mechanism for detached events.

tasks.title: Audit Settings pane data vs backend and propose refactor
tasks.description: Review the renderer SettingsPane UI, compare each field to the backend/electron data model and persistence format, and prepare a refactor plan covering API alignment, missing hydration, and validation logic so the settings screen works end-to-end.

tasks.title: Fix ReferenceError in LLMService usage_breakdown emission
tasks.description: Fix ReferenceError: costEstimate is not defined in LLMService. The variable was likely removed during refactor but still referenced in usage_breakdown event emission.

tasks.title: Refactor Settings Pane & Data Sync
tasks.description:
Execute the refactor plan for the Settings pane:
1. Define `SettingsSnapshot` type.
2. Update backend `settings.get` to return full snapshot.
3. Update backend RPCs for Fireworks to match renderer needs.
4. Create `useSettingsSnapshot` hook in renderer.
5. Refactor `SettingsPane` to use the hook and new RPCs.
6. Ensure startup message is correctly piped.

tasks.title: Remove indexing section from Settings screen
tasks.description: The Settings view still shows an "Indexing" section even though indexes are no longer supported. Remove the entire section from the renderer UI (and any associated state/IPC wiring that is now obsolete), ensuring the remaining Settings panels render correctly on all platforms.

tasks.title: Fix Usage Badge Renderer Listener
tasks.description: Investigate why the usage breakdown event is not updating the renderer UI, even though it is being broadcast. Fix the listener or state update logic in the renderer.

tasks.title: Reduce setUsage emissions to avoid frontend rerender storms
tasks.description: Limit setUsage emissions to only when LLM usage information is received (usage_breakdown / final result), eliminating per-chunk updates that cause frontend rerender storms.

tasks.title: Fix usage badge not appearing in session timeline
tasks.description: usage_breakdown events are emitted with null nodeId/executionId; badges do not appear in session timeline. Fix LLMService emission and timeline-event-handler robustness.

tasks.title: Persist flow/provider selection across sessions
tasks.description: When starting a new session, reuse the flow and provider/model previously selected. When loading a saved session, preselect the flow and provider/model last used in that session so the widgets reflect the actual runtime configuration.

tasks.title: Fix await usage syntax error in SessionControlsBar metadata sync
tasks.description: Vite build fails with "Unexpected reserved word 'await'" in src/components/SessionControlsBar.tsx:127. Ensure any awaiting of metadata update promises occurs inside an async function or via .then, and restore working flow status widget controls.

tasks.title: KB: Document Token Usage Fix
tasks.description: Update KB with fix details for token usage and cost architecture.

tasks.title: Fix TokensCostsPanel rendering
tasks.description: Investigate and fix why TokensCostsPanel is not displaying data despite receiving it.

tasks.title: Fix flow status widget start/stop controls
tasks.description: Start/stop buttons in the flow status widget do not consistently work and perform the wrong actions when they do. Investigate the renderer-side logic, wire up the correct IPC/flow-engine calls, and ensure the widget accurately reflects and controls the flow runtime state. Add regression coverage if possible.

tasks.title: Audit and Refactor Token/Cost Usage Architecture
tasks.description: Audit how token and cost usage is emitted from main and consumed by renderer. Consolidate overlapping code paths into a clean architecture. Ensure usage_breakdown and setUsage events are consistent and efficient.

tasks.title: Investigate workspaceMap behavior and usefulness
tasks.description: LLMs report that workspaceMap does not return useful data. Determine the intended output/behavior of workspaceMap and document how it should work so we can adjust implementation accordingly.

tasks.title: Fix syntax error in event-subscriptions.ts
tasks.description: Fix syntax error in electron/backend/ws/event-subscriptions.ts where a const declaration was misplaced inside an object or function call.

tasks.title: Add default pricing for gpt-5.1
tasks.description:
Add default pricing for gpt-5.1:
Input: $1.250 / 1M tokens
Cached input: $0.125 / 1M tokens
Output: $10.000 / 1M tokens

tasks.title: Refactor flow engine context architecture for single-writer ContextManager and multi-context support
tasks.description:
Implement single-writer ContextManager for the main flow context, refactor LMService/llmRequest to use it, and adapt manualInput/userInput/injectMessages/newContext nodes. Multi-context isolated flows are temporarily degraded and will be reintroduced with per-context managers in a follow-up task.

Progress tracker:
- [x] Single-writer ContextManager integration + node refactors
- [x] Context registry + automatic context propagation/multi-context scheduling (dedicated ContextRegistry + tests)
- [x] FlowAPI contexts helper + isolated context lifecycle utilities
- [x] Renderer/websocket sync + portal/context-edge validation
- [x] End-to-end & regression tests for multi-context flows

tasks.title: Fix Null Usage Badge Emission
tasks.description: Investigate why LLMService is emitting usage_breakdown events with null nodeId and executionId, preventing badges from appearing.

tasks.title: Fix 'Usage Badge' Missing Issue
tasks.description: Investigate and fix the missing Usage badge issue related to 'usage_breakdown' event handling.

tasks.title: Investigate and resolve 'Usage badge' missing issue
tasks.description: Debug why the 'Usage badge' does not appear after LLM execution. Current logs indicate that `LLMService` may not emit the `usage_breakdown` event properly. Check the flow and ensure that the badge is updated accordingly when `llmService.chat` completes without an error.

tasks.title: Implement Usage Badge Display After LLM Execution
tasks.description: Define and implement the logic for displaying usage badges in the session timeline after LLM execution by ensuring event emission and badge update mechanism.

tasks.title: Fix message history being overwritten in LLMService chat context
tasks.description: Investigate why messageHistory is no longer preserved across turns and is overwritten with only the latest user/agent pair. Ensure flow context merging/appending logic correctly accumulates history instead of replacing it.

tasks.title: Refactor flow engine context architecture for single-writer context API
tasks.description:
Design and implement a clean architecture where FlowScheduler.mainContext is the single source of truth and only a dedicated Context API can mutate it. Nodes must treat context as immutable input and communicate state changes exclusively through the Context API. This includes redesigning LMService/chat, userInput, and scheduler-node integration so messageHistory and other context fields are never overwritten accidentally.

Closed: solved comprehensively by task-619a5f3d-dc19-42a9-b48f-ea7d22b87ef4 (single-writer ContextManager + ContextRegistry refactor).

tasks.title: Fix LM node context overwrite of messageHistory
tasks.description:

Closed: redundant after the comprehensive refactor delivered in task-619a5f3d-dc19-42a9-b48f-ea7d22b87ef4.

tasks.title: Fix LM node context overwrite of messageHistory
tasks.description:

Closed: covered by task-619a5f3d-dc19-42a9-b48f-ea7d22b87ef4 deliverables (single-writer context + flush integration tests).

tasks.title: Fix message history overwrite when LM node executes
tasks.description:

tasks.title: Fix duplicated flow context and messageHistory not iterable error
tasks.description:

tasks.title: Fix duplicated flow context and messageHistory not iterable error
tasks.description:
FlowScheduler error: `context.messageHistory is not iterable`. Root cause likely due to keeping duplicate context objects (FlowScheduler context vs flowAPI.context) and syncing them in two directions. Need to refactor flow context handling so there is a single source of truth, or a clear, one-way sync, and ensure messageHistory is always an array when used.

tasks.description: Fix syntax error in ProviderService.ts where async methods were defined without bodies and orphaned code was present.

tasks.description: Investigate and fix the issue where costs are 0.00 in the Tokens & Costs panel, likely due to missing pricing configuration for new models.

tasks.title: Update Badge Header to show Tool Name

tasks.title: Fix 'None' artifacts in Fireworks provider
tasks.description:
User reported "None" artifacts appearing before thinking blocks or after tool calls in Fireworks/DeepSeek R1 models.
Root cause: Model/Provider emitting "None" as a text chunk before reasoning.
Fix: Implemented buffering in FireworksAiSdkProvider to drop "None" artifacts.
Verified with standalone test script.
